values: Feeding a senior through Meals on Wheels costs $2,765 a year. President Trump wants to slash their funding.
The National School Lunch Program provides food assistance to children in schools for only $416 per child per year.
Helping low-income people access health care through Medicaid costs $5,790 per recipient a year. President Trump continues to threaten Medicaid funding.
Trump wants to cut the U.S. Interagency Council on Homelessness which combats homelessness, particularly for veterans, and only costs $4 million a year to run.
The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) helps millions of families put food on the table and only costs $1.39 a meal.
It costs a public school around $12,296 a year to educate students.
Pell Grants help low-income students pay for college and have been on Trump's chopping block.
President Trump donated his first quarter's salary to the National Park Service, which is a drop in the bucket compared to the taxpayer money spent on Mar-a-Lago trips.
